text:
I’m heartbroken by the loss of three brave officers killed in York County, PA, and I’m praying for the two who were critically injured. These heroes made the ultimate sacrifice to keep their community safe.

My prayers are with their families, loved ones, and fellow officers. We must continue to support those who risk everything to protect us. https://t.co/ECfwUpVlzW

Today in @TransportGOP, I highlighted that Mississippi is the only Gulf Coast state without a nationally designated estuary program.

I proudly supported the Mississippi Sound Estuary Program — key legislation to protect our coast, support seafood and tourism, and bring long-overdue federal investment to Mississippi.

This bill puts us on track for EPA review and finally gives Mississippi a fair shake. Glad to see it pass out of committee!

On this day, we pause to reflect on the tragedy that forever changed our country. We honor the memory of those who perished, the heroes who risked everything to save others, and the resilience of a nation united in the face of unspeakable horror. 

Their courage and sacrifice inspire us to uphold the values of freedom, justice, and unity that define America. May we never forget the lessons of that day, and may we always strive to build a safer, stronger America for future generations.

My heart goes out to Charlie Kirk, who was shot today during a speaking engagement at Utah Valley University. I’m praying for him, his family, and friends during this uncertain time. No one should face violence while exercising their right to speak.

I’m also praying for the students, staff, and all impacted at UVU in Orem. May God grant healing, protection, and peace to them—and may those responsible be swiftly brought to justice.

As a former law enforcement officer, I know firsthand how soft-on-crime policies play out - and Americans are witnessing the effects of these horrible policies. 

We must be tough on crime. We must ban cashless bail. We must restore law and order to our country, NOW!

Promises made, promises kept. 

@POTUS promised to eradicate all drug cartels and their illicit substances from American streets, and the @DEAHQ did just that last month. 

➡️ 480 kilograms of fentanyl powder
➡️ 2,209 kilograms of methamphetamine
➡️ 7,469 kilograms of cocaine
➡️ 16.5 kilograms of heroin
➡️ more than 714,000 counterfeit pills
➡️ 420 illegal firearms
➡️ $11 million in cash
https://t.co/Q6T3QcKe3L

Grateful for the men and women of the Mississippi National Guard serving in our nation’s capital. My wife, Suzette, had the chance to thank them in a small way—she made sure they had some cookies while they’re here protecting DC. 

We couldn’t be prouder of their service and sacrifice!

Great to see our future healthcare leaders in action at the Singing River Health System Health Care Academy in Ocean Springs!

Over 250 high school students from across South Mississippi participated in a hands-on career and technical education event, earning clinical hours and exploring specialties like pharmacy, orthopedics, and emergency medicine.

This initiative is a fantastic step toward building a skilled healthcare workforce right here at home.

https://t.co/7sPVwFxgLz

Too many cities across South Mississippi have lost trust in FEMA—and for good reason. Time and again, FEMA has failed to deliver on contracts to rebuild vital infrastructure after devastating storms. Our communities deserve better than broken promises.

That’s why I’m proud that @TransportGOP is marking up a legislative package today to reform FEMA and hold the agency accountable. I’ll keep fighting to make sure the Gulf Coast gets the support it’s owed.

20 years ago, the Coast faced unimaginable loss. But through heartbreak came resilience—neighbors helping neighbors and communities rising stronger than ever.

Today, we honor what was lost, recognize how far we’ve come, and recommit to never forgetting. https://t.co/1cJAJ08UcW

This morning, I had the chance to visit with the Alzheimer’s Association at Jacked Up Coffee in Biloxi. We had a great conversation about the challenges families face and the importance of continuing the fight against Alzheimer’s. 

I’ll keep working to support research, caregivers, and patients here on the Coast and across the country.

My heart is heavy with sorrow over this morning’s senseless violence at Ingalls Shipbuilding. Our community is grieving today—not just for the life that was tragically lost—but for all who were shaken by this traumatic event. I extend my deepest condolences to the family of the deceased, and I pray for the safety and peace of every worker and resident affected.

I commend the swift, coordinated efforts of our law enforcement agencies, first responders, and Shipyard personnel, whose immediate response undoubtedly prevented further harm. This somber moment underscores the urgent need for continued safeguards and support systems to protect our workplaces and keep our communities secure.

My office stands ready to work with local leaders, the shipyard, law enforcement, and mental health professionals to ensure survivors and their families receive the resources and care they need. In this fragile time, unity and compassion are our strongest assets.

I support Judge Persons’ ruling that protects Mississippi’s public oyster reefs from privatization. Our reefs belong to the people, and this decision ensures Gulf Coast oystermen can continue their way of life while preserving our state’s maritime heritage.

Social Security is a promise our nation made to hardworking Americans—ensuring they can retire with dignity after decades of work. For nearly 90 years, it has provided critical support to millions of seniors, people with disabilities, and surviving family members.

Every American who has paid into the system deserves the peace of mind it was designed to provide.

Yesterday, I was glad to join @anduriltech for the ribbon cutting of their brand new facility right here in Mississippi’s Fourth District. This investment brings cutting-edge defense technology — and good-paying jobs — to our community.

I’m proud to support the mission and momentum of companies like Anduril that strengthen our national security and our local economy.

Earlier this month, I pressed @SecDuffy on how we can cut the red tape around these overregulated gas cans. 

Take a look ⬇️ https://t.co/QnOKjgZ33X

Honored to meet with the brave @USCG members who helped save hundreds of lives during the life-threatening flash flooding in Kerrville, Texas.

Their quick thinking, courage, and dedication represent the very best of our Coast Guard and our country.

Thank you for your service — we’re proud to stand with you! 🇺🇸⚓

It’s long past time that the @USCG receives the full support and funding it needs to carry out its vital mission. The courageous men and women of the Coast Guard are on the front lines—protecting our borders, stopping illegal crossings, and intercepting dangerous narcotics.

Today, @HouseGOP is bringing the Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2025 to the House floor to ensure the Coast Guard has the tools and resources it deserves.
https://t.co/sv6OUEMnjV

Dawson Thompson, born with achondroplasia and raised in Pascagoula, showed incredible heart by walking every hole at the U.S. Adaptive Open. 

I was proud to take to the House floor to honor his grit and perseverance. Mississippi is behind you, Dawson — this is just the beginning!

Last night, I had the honor of discussing legislation I’m working on to help create a clear path for preserving more @rigstoreef habitats in the Gulf of America.

It was great to join @RepWesterman and Louisiana Governor @JeffLandry to highlight the importance of this effort and how it supports marine ecosystems, fishing communities, and conservation in the Gulf region.

Big win for Mississippi’s catfish farmers, sportsmen, and conservationists!

Proud to help lead this effort on @NatResources — it’s just common sense to let local experts manage the challenges they know best. This is about protecting our fisheries, supporting our aquaculture industry, and restoring balance in our ecosystems.

.@RepWebster said it perfectly — our Coasties are always ready to step up in times of crisis.

This week, @TransportGOP is taking the first step to fix years of underfunding by advancing the Coast Guard Reauthorization Act of 2025. Our Coast Guard deserves the tools to do the job.

https://t.co/YARC2g2I8Z
Congratulations on an outstanding career, Bo! All of us in #MS04 wish you nothing but the best as you head into a well-earned retirement. Enjoy this next chapter!

This #FourthOfJuly, we honor the bold spirit of 1776 and those who’ve sacrificed for our freedom ever since. Liberty endures because the brave defend it.

🇺🇸 “The land of the free only so long as it is the home of the brave.” —Elmer Davis

Happy Independence Day from Team Ezell! https://t.co/ENPQZfwcjX

Today, I had the privilege of recognizing Lt. Col. Boyd Mason — a true American hero and a dear friend from South Mississippi.

His courage, service, and steadfast faith continue to leave a mark on everyone he meets. May his example inspire us all to live with purpose, humility, and honor.

Heartbroken to hear of Coach Joye Lee-McNelis’ passing — a Mississippi legend and true fighter. She led with heart, faith, and strength, inspiring so many on and off the court.

Praying for her family, her players, and the Southern Miss community.

https://t.co/J4pQukorsK

The One Big Beautiful Bill gives the Coast Guard over $21 billion to do what they do best — protect our waters and our people.

✅It gives them the tools to stop illegal drugs before the poison ever reaches our shores.
✅To stop illegal migrants and traffickers before they land on our beaches.
✅To keep watch on China and Russia in the Arctic — before they threaten our future.

As Chairman of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee, I’m proud to back this bill.

Always a good day when my alma mater, @SouthernMiss, visits our D.C. office.

Grateful to Dr. Paul for his leadership and for keeping my team and me up to date on all the great things happening at USM. Southern Miss to the Top! https://t.co/LURsK6vX4u

Today in @TransportGOP, I emphasized the critical need to reform the permitting process under the Clean Water Act. Streamlining these permits is a key step to boosting American industry, creating jobs, and strengthening our economy. 

Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/sBXjAF7fUF

Our Coasties are the first responders of our waters —they deserve the tools, resources, and respect they’ve earned.

As Chairman of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee, I penned an op-ed in the  @WashTimes urging Congress to pass the bipartisan Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2025.

Read more ⬇️
https://t.co/pWWggBOK47

Had a great time meeting with students from the Trent Lott Leadership Institute! It’s always encouraging to see young Mississippians engaged in public service, leadership, and policy. The future is bright with leaders like these on the rise! https://t.co/KFt3eNo7mg

Over the weekend, Team Ezell was proud to help honor Mr. Audie Gardner, a U.S. Navy veteran from Wayne County, on his 100th birthday.

Mr. Gardner’s life of faith, service, and humility reflects the very best of American values. Happy 100th, sir—and thank you for your service and example!
My statement regarding @POTUS's recent military strike targeting Iran’s nuclear weapons infrastructure ⬇️ https://t.co/EeJbg34vOz

Happy Father’s Day to all the incredible dads across Mississippi’s 4th District!

As a father and grandfather, I know there’s no greater joy—or responsibility—than family. Today, we celebrate the men who lead with strength, love, and quiet sacrifice! https://t.co/eUMbEMDyp0

Israel has every right to defend itself against the constant threats posed by the Iranian regime. Last night’s action was a clear message that attacks on Israeli sovereignty and security will not go unanswered. I stand firmly with our ally Israel as it takes the necessary steps to protect its people and preserve stability in the region.

Mississippi’s Fourth District is home to the Gulf Coast National Heritage Area which hasn’t received its FY’25 funding, and there’s no clear timeline for release.

I asked @SecretaryBurgum for an update, and he promised to get to the bottom of it.

Watch it ⬇️ https://t.co/yx5TMqyDox

Today, the House will vote on a key rescissions package to restore fiscal responsibility, saving American taxpayers $9.4 billion. 

It reins in wasteful spending and reclaims funds from programs that don’t align with the Trump agenda.

Great meeting today with Dr. Mark Keenum, President of @msstate!

We had a productive discussion about expanding educational opportunities, supporting ag research, and preparing Mississippi students for the jobs of tomorrow. Proud to partner with Bulldog Nation to build a stronger future for our state.

Team Ezell was proud to help celebrate the grand opening of Buc-ee’s in Harrison County—an $80 million investment that’s bringing over 200 jobs. This location is one of the largest Buc-ee’s in the country, and now, proudly part of Mississippi.

https://t.co/aIcoTzzRRC

This is disgraceful - @RepJeffries you should be ashamed. As a former sheriff, I know firsthand the risks our law enforcement officers face every day. Threatening to expose the identities of ICE agents not only endangers their lives—it emboldens violent cartels and gangs.

We stand with our officers, not with criminals - looks like you need to reevaluate your priorities.

On the 81st anniversary of D-Day, let us remember and immortalize the brave sacrifice that our military made to ensure freedom for folks not just in France, but around the world.

May we never forget the cost of freedom and our responsibility to uphold democracy. https://t.co/0WAXcvKHax

Our Coast Guard is always ready — now it’s our turn to support them. 💪🇺🇸

The One Big, Beautiful Bill delivers big wins:
✅ Modernized fleet
✅ Better training
✅ Stronger capabilities

We’re not done. I’ll keep fighting for the tools they need. https://t.co/NXO2u3dD32

This week, the @USCG Cutter Storis embarked on its maiden voyage! This new polar icebreaker, the first added to the fleet in 25 years, will bolster our nation's presence and capabilities in the Arctic. 

Homeported in Juneau, Alaska, the Storis honors its predecessor's legacy of service and strengthens our commitment to national security in the region. A significant step forward for the Coast Guard and our country!https://t.co/r97QHT0FgL
Thanks for stopping by! It was great to catch up with folks from South Mississippi.

I wrapped up #MS04's 2025 South Mississippi Shipyard Tour by visiting the United States Coast Guard Station in Pascagoula. This tour has been an incredible opportunity to witness firsthand the dedication, skill, and innovation driving our region’s shipbuilding industry — a critical backbone of our local economy and national security.
At the Pascagoula @USCG Station, I was impressed by the professionalism and commitment of our Coast Guard personnel who work tirelessly to protect our waters, safeguard commerce, and support our communities. Their mission is vital, and I’m proud that South Mississippi plays such a key role in supporting their efforts.
As we move forward, I remain committed to advocating for resources that strengthen our shipyards, support our workers, and ensure our military and Coast Guard are equipped to meet future challenges.

Thank you for hosting Admiral Lunday and me yesterday! We truly appreciate the opportunity to witness the impressive work your shipyard is doing to support the U.S. Coast Guard. We look forward to seeing the continued progress and innovation ahead.

Yesterday, my team and I kicked off our 2025 Shipyard Tour at @Austal_USA in Mobile, Alabama, and @BollingerShip in Pascagoula, MS! 

I was honored to be joined by Admiral Kevin Lunday, Acting Commandant of the @USCG. We toured the two shipyards and witnessed the incredible craftsmanship and dedication of their workforces, who are dedicated to building the Offshore Patrol Cutters and Polar Security Cutters— vital assets for our nation’s maritime security.

The Coast Guard’s mission to protect our waters and uphold national authority is more important than ever, and these cutters are essential to that effort. Proud to stand with those who build the ships that keep our country safe.
https://t.co/pK4sZxfRoT

Suzette and I are deeply saddened and praying for the families and loved ones of the two Israeli embassy staffers tragically murdered last night during an event at the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C.

This senseless act of antisemitic violence is utterly abhorrent and has no place in our world. We will not stand idly by in the face of hatred, and I have no doubt that those responsible for this heinous crime will be brought to justice.
My statement on passage of the One Big, Beautiful Bill: https://t.co/IgROlUu1ST

Today, @Sec_Noem introduced Admiral Kevin E. Lunday as the 28th Commandant of the @USCG, pending Senate confirmation. Admiral Lunday is poised to lead the service through a pivotal period of transformation.

As Chairman of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee, I commend Noem and Lunday for their forward-looking leadership. Their commitment to modernizing the Coast Guard will help ensure our nation remains secure and ready to meet the challenges of the future.
Tune in at 11:35 am EST as I chat about our One Big, Beautiful Bill that @HouseGOP is working to get across the finish line this week!

This Police Week, one name carried personal weight: Deputy Bruce Evans, the former partner of my Chief of Staff who was killed in the line of duty in 2000. His memory is a powerful reminder of the bonds we form in this profession and the heartbreak when we lose one of our own. 

We will never forget his service or sacrifice.

During National Police Week, we do more than honor the badge—we stand up for those who wear it.

As former sheriffs, @RepRutherfordFL and I know firsthand the risks law enforcement face. This week isn’t just about gratitude—it’s a call to action.

Let’s equip our officers with the tools they need. ⬇️

https://t.co/olthUsKbOO
Bipartisan support for my resolution to honor law enforcement during National Police Week: 411 yes…1 no vote. Guess @RepRashida didn’t get the ‘back the blue’ memo. https://t.co/UDhLBjIz6t

Growing up on Mississippi’s Gulf Coast, I know how important the shrimp industry is—not just to our economy, but to our way of life. Our local Gulf Coast shrimpers are playing by the rules while foreign producers are flooding the market with unsafe, low-quality products. This bill is about leveling the playing field and protecting our American producers, and keeping America healthy.

Read more⬇️
https://t.co/H9PZzzAUqR

"This National Police Week, we reflect on how our time in Congress isn’t the first time we’ve raised our right hand and sworn an oath to defend this country...The time we spent serving our neighbors as police officers is the inspiration for serving our neighbors as members of Congress."

Read more of the op-ed that @repgabeevans and I penned with @thehill:
https://t.co/EljocDWelu

Last week, Team Ezell joined the Biloxi PD to honor officers who gave their lives in the line of duty.

As National Police Week begins, we remember their sacrifice—and the sacrifice of their families. 

https://t.co/jIuFDuKDDx

American families deserve to know that justice will be served—no matter where a crime takes place. If someone is in this country illegally and commits murder, the federal government should have the authority to prosecute them to the fullest extent of the law. This bill sends a clear message: if you take an innocent life on American soil, you will be held accountable.
https://t.co/vI39s6HTAb

Thank you, @Sec_Noem, for bringing the obvious to the forefront! For the last 20 years, victims of Katrina have fought tooth and nail to get the funds they deserve to rebuild their communities along the coast – this is just one of the massive failures that FEMA is responsible for. 

▪️Delayed funding, often by decades, resulting in States paying interest for years, without support.
▪️Constant legal battles spanning decades, over every penny.
▪️Rebuilding is delayed or nullified

The list of failures and incompetence goes on and on. @rosadelauro, I am sure many in Connecticut do not deal with FEMA regularly, but South Mississippi is in constant contact with FEMA, so feel free to stop by my office to get up to date. There is no doubt that FEMA is broken.

This morning, I joined a bipartisan working group to discuss how Congress can support our law enforcement officers and address the challenges they face. As a former sheriff with 40 years in law enforcement, I know firsthand what our officers need to do their jobs safely and effectively. Working together, we can find real solutions that strengthen public safety and ensure our officers have the tools and support they deserve.

Today, I introduced the KITS Act with @RepCarbajal, a bipartisan bill aimed at ensuring FEMA disaster recovery projects are overseen by professionals licensed in the affected state. This legislation emphasizes the importance of local expertise in rebuilding efforts, ensuring that community standards and practices are upheld.

Key Highlights:
‼️Prioritizes local professionals in FEMA projects.
‼️Ensures adherence to state-specific building codes and standards.
‼️Aims to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of disaster recovery.

Read more about the KITS Act and its implications for our communities⬇️
https://t.co/FeVLLlxA9z

Great news for Mississippi and American maritime security: the U.S. Coast Guard has approved full production of the Polar Security Cutter, to be built at Bollinger Mississippi Shipbuilding in Pascagoula. 

This marks a significant step in strengthening our presence in the Arctic and Antarctic regions, ensuring that our nation remains prepared and resilient in the face of evolving global challenges. 

I'm proud to support initiatives that bolster our national security and create good-paying jobs for Mississippians.

Read more about this development here: https://t.co/TXUPe78twa

Today, on the National Day of Prayer, I’m especially grateful for the power of prayer and the strength it gives us as individuals, as communities, and as a nation.

I was honored to host a group of preachers from Mississippi here in Washington who took the time to pray over me and the work we’re doing in Congress.

May God continue to bless our great state and the United States of America.

Great news for South Mississippi’s shrimpers, fishermen, and coastal communities: the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers has announced that the Bonnet Carré Spillway will remain closed, as the Mississippi River is cresting lower than expected. ​

This decision spares our marine ecosystems from the harmful influx of freshwater, protecting our seafood industry and the livelihoods that depend on it.

I remain committed to working with the Corps to find long-term solutions that seek to fairly spread outcomes across a multi-step strategy that will protect our coast, strengthen our economy, and prevent these challenges from continuing in the future.

https://t.co/2pbXjwSJ40

Proud to introduce the BRIDGE Act alongside @RepDanCrenshaw, @RepClayHiggins, and @TXRandy14!

This legislation mandates offshore oil and gas lease sales in the Gulf of America, bolstering American energy security, creating good-paying jobs, and supporting economic growth along the Gulf Coast.​

Energy independence is crucial for our national security and economy.​

Read more about the BRIDGE Act here: https://t.co/V5imXP6qqM

The American people gave us a clear mandate: put America First. 

Tomorrow, @TransportGOP will mark up a proposal to help deliver on President Trump’s bold agenda. Proud to be part of this effort. 

Read more here: https://t.co/sPHGSOOxIc

During @POTUS's first 100 days, the Coast Guard has worked around the clock to defend our maritime borders and stop the flow of illegal drugs and migrants. I’m proud that President Trump is recognizing their hard work—service that too often goes unnoticed but is vital to our national security.

As Chairman of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee, I’ll continue working with the administration to ensure the Coast Guard has the tools, resources, and support it needs to stay mission-ready.

I strongly oppose the continued overuse of the Bonnet Carré Spillway. Each time it’s opened, it sends a flood of freshwater into the Mississippi Sound, threatening the delicate balance of our ecosystem and causing serious harm to South Mississippi’s fishing and shrimping industries—and, ultimately, our economy.

We understand the concerns of our neighbors in New Orleans and throughout Louisiana. Protecting people and property from flooding is critically important—but there are other options. Relying on the Bonnet Carré year after year is not sustainable, especially for our coastal communities.

Instead of waiting until we’re in a crisis, we should be using smarter, long-term strategies—like gradually opening spillways over time—to reduce pressure without overwhelming our waters. That kind of planning would go a long way in protecting both lives and livelihoods across the Gulf Coast.

I’m committed to fighting for solutions that protect all our communities—without putting South Mississippi at risk.

Strong leadership gets results. 👏

Thanks to President Trump’s policies, illegal crossings are down, and border security is finally being taken seriously again. A 99.99% drop from the worst Biden month speaks for itself. Let’s keep putting America’s safety first.

It’s a bridge that’s been more than 100 years in the making — and today, drivers in Hattiesburg are finally getting some relief.

Proud to join local leaders and neighbors for the ribbon cutting of the new Hall Avenue West Overpass! This project will ease traffic, improve safety, and help keep Hattiesburg growing strong. Grateful to see long-awaited infrastructure finally becoming a reality.

I strongly condemn the horrific terrorist attack in India’s Kashmir region and extend my deepest condolences to the victims and their families, as well as prayers for a swift recovery for the injured.

Visited Hybrid Plastics in Hattiesburg today—an incredible Mississippi company doing groundbreaking work. They’ve developed a polymer that could help treat combat wounds and save lives on the battlefield. Proud to see innovation like this happening right here in our state. https://t.co/vu3YP7rulz
He is Risen! Have a very happy and blessed Easter! https://t.co/1J9OqqgDow

Proud to support President Trump’s executive order to revive American seafood. This is a big win for our Gulf Coast—cutting red tape, fighting unfair trade, and standing up for our fishermen.

https://t.co/mrI1Nrt8uz
On Good Friday, we remember the profound sacrifice that brought hope to the world. https://t.co/41akZTL0B4

Exciting things are happening on the Mississippi Gulf Coast! I recently stopped by Woolpert’s Maritime Systems Hub.

This collaborative space brings together entrepreneurs, startups, and companies working on cutting-edge maritime technology and sustainable ocean innovation. 

Proud to see Mississippi leading the way in maritime innovation and sustainable ocean technologies!

In just 100 days, we’ve delivered real results for the American people. 

Here's a look at just a few highlights:
✅ S.J. Res. 11 – My resolution to overturn a burdensome Biden admin rule was signed into law by President Trump,
✅ Laken Riley Act – Now law, holding illegal immigrant criminals accountable, and
✅ SAVE Act – Passed the House to safeguard our elections and ensure only American citizens vote.

We’re just getting started.

I recently sat down with @AMPmaritime to discuss why the Jones Act is critical to protecting our national security, strengthening our economy, and supporting American jobs. Proud to stand with the men and women of our maritime industry who keep America moving. ⚓🇺🇸

🎧 Watch here: https://t.co/fL8xQUNmyA

Great to have @SecVetAffairs in MS-04 today. We visited veteran health care and nursing facilities, met with staff, and heard from the heroes who’ve served our country. Grateful for his commitment to our veterans. https://t.co/8WQnHwyDBZ

Today, I voted in favor of the SAVE Act, critical legislation that strengthens the integrity of our elections by ensuring only American citizens are allowed to vote in federal elections.

Free and fair elections are the foundation of our democracy. Every legal vote must count, and every illegal vote must be prevented. The SAVE Act is a commonsense step to protect the voice of American citizens and uphold the rule of law at the ballot box.

I’ll always stand for secure elections and the right of Americans to have confidence in the outcomes.

Tune in to WMXI at 7:15AM CST as I join Michael Pol and Ted Tibbett to give my latest update from Washington!

https://t.co/wlsYdSDTeN
These are the results of executing a strong plan with the necessary leadership to back  it up!

In a @NatResources hearing, I pressed NOIA’s Mr. Milito on NOAA’s upcoming Biological Opinion for Gulf energy. 

This decision impacts U.S. energy independence & Gulf Coast jobs. We need clarity, accountability, & a strong commitment to American energy. 

Watch below 👇 https://t.co/1MPNKiGex7

"𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙅𝙤𝙣𝙚𝙨 𝘼𝙘𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙦𝙪𝙞𝙩𝙚 𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙙𝙧𝙤𝙘𝙠 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙛𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙤𝙛 𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙣𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣’𝙨 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙢𝙚𝙧𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙨𝙝𝙞𝙥𝙗𝙪𝙞𝙡𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙪𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙗𝙖𝙨𝙚, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙬𝙚 𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙙𝙡𝙮 𝙨𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙞𝙩." 

@RepCarbajal and I stand firm in defending the Jones Act — protecting American jobs, strengthening our national security, and keeping our shipbuilding industry strong. 

Read our latest opinion piece here⬇️
https://t.co/r1YvjiYgmq

Today, we honor the brave men and women who have received the Medal of Honor—the highest award for valor in combat. These heroes exemplify the very best of our nation, demonstrating extraordinary courage and selflessness in the face of danger.

On this National Medal of Honor Day, we express our deepest gratitude to these warriors and their families. May we always remember their bravery and strive to uphold the values they fought to protect.

Happy #NationalAgDay! Agriculture is the backbone of Mississippi’s economy, supporting 420,373 jobs and driving $871.4 million in exports. Our farmers, ranchers, and producers work tirelessly to feed America and the world. I’ll always fight for policies that strengthen our ag industry and protect our way of life.

NOW OPEN: The 2025 Congressional Art Competition for Mississippi's Fourth District is now taking submissions, and the deadline to submit artwork is Friday, April 18th, 2025. 

The Congressional Art Competition is open to all high school students, grades 9-12, who live or attend school in Mississippi's Fourth Congressional District. 

To learn more about the competition please visit: https://t.co/C0DUzJv9fM

ICYMI: @POTUS just signed my resolution to unleash American energy production, rolling back burdensome regulations that have held us back for too long. This is a win for American workers, energy independence, and lower costs for families across the country.

https://t.co/SflHD5Pt7z

🚨Big win for American energy!🚨

The Biden admin’s rule hurt our energy producers, raised costs & made us reliant on foreign adversaries. Overturning it strengthens our future.

Thank you, @POTUS, for fighting for affordable, reliable energy! https://t.co/dxo8h44FEz
Working every day to make America—and the world—safer. Thank you, @POTUS!
